title: This is how I see it.
body:
In my opinion this is how the factors of AD/AP Tankiness and Hard CC should be decided in champ select.

First up is to sort out the AD/AP ratio of the team, this is what i think the order is:
(morde isn't included in this, he is still an anomaly in the game atm)

ADC gets first pick because they can only go ranged AD DPS champs, so they get first pick by default.
Top gets second pick, they can choose either AD or AP.
Jungle gets 3rd pick they can make a judgement on what best suits the team.
Mid gets 4th pick, they look at the AD/AP of the team and make a judgement as to which will balance the scales and choose that.
Support gets 5th and last pick because there are no AD supports 

Next us is tankiness this is the order to decide who goes tanky or not,

ADC is first pick because there are no ADC tanks
Mid gets next pick, because they have the choice to prioritise damage.
Support gets 3rd pick, they can choose either a healer/cc or tank because its up to them to best select champs to benefit their ADC
Jungle gets 4th pick, they look at the team again and decide what best suits.
Top gets 5th and last pick, if no one else picks tank they have to pick it. 

Next is hard CC this order decides who has CC or not

Support is first, they make the best judgement as to if they want to roll CC
ADC is next, there isn't much choice for CC in ADC so they are high priority in the pick list by default.
Top is next, they get do decide to have hard CC or not
Jungle is next if no-one else has hard CC its their job to pick a champ with some.
Mid is last, if no one else has hard CC or only 1 person has it, they are basically obliged to take some.

exceptions to this are structuring a team around Yas, or wanting to do a Malph/Ori engage etc
